thread.title: Union strike: Bank operations to take a hit on payday, SBI to remain open
thread.title_full: Union strike: Bank operations to take a hit on payday, SBI to remain open | The Financial Express

author: financialexpress.com
title: Union strike: Bank operations to take a hit on payday, SBI to remain open
text:
Banking operations across the country are likely to be hit on Wednesday, as most of the banks, barring State Bank of India, will go on a nationwide strike. This could be a dampener for the lakhs of salaried class who eagerly wait for their monthly pay.
About 13 lakhs employed at 24 state-run banks, eleven private banks, nine foreign banks and 56 regional rural banks and 650 cooperative banks will go on strike. This would mean about 1,00,000 bank branches would remain closed.
People can withdraw from ATM’S, as they are managed by third-party private firms who will not be part of the nationwide strike. But, if the machines run out of cash, they will not be replenished, due to lack of bank staff to give them cash.
Clearing of cheques and loan documentation will also be affected, as the work is done at the branches.
Only respite is that internet banking will work, because the Reserve Bank of India’s clearing will remain open.
Employee unions at State Bank of India are not participating in the strike on Wednesday. SBI bank branches will remain open, giving a major relief to salaried class.
First Published on September 01, 2015 8:07 pm
